com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver

Class Number

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver.Number

  • public class Number
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a number/fraction/mixed-number such as 35, 45/6, 56<36><32>, and provides methods for adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing numbers.
    Author:
    Nateowami

    • Constructor Detail

      • Number

        public Number()
        Constructs a new empty Number

      • Number

        public Number(java.lang.String num)
        Constructs a new number. Calling it with an empty string will throw errors (index out of bounds)
        Parameters:
        num - The number to parse into a Number. Example: 45<67>/<98>

    • Method Detail

      • parseFraction

        private void parseFraction(java.lang.String frac)
        Parses the fraction part of a number and initialises the vars top and bottom
        Parameters:
        frac - The fraction to parse

      • getWholeNumber

        public java.lang.String getWholeNumber()
        Returns:
        the wholeNumber part of the mixed number

      • getTop

        public java.lang.String getTop()
        Returns:
        the numerator of the fraction

      • getBottom

        public java.lang.String getBottom()
        Returns:
        the denominator of the fraction

      • add

        public static Number add(Number n1,
         Number n2)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds two numbers and returns the result
        Parameters:
        n1 - The first Number
        n2 - The second Number
        Returns:
        A Number equal to the value of the two numbers added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the denominators of the fractions of the two numbers (if they have fractions, that is) are not equal

      • add

        private static java.lang.String add(java.lang.String n1,
                   java.lang.String n2)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds two numbers represented by a String. This should not be confused with adding two Numbers; this only adds integer/decimal values represented by a string
        Parameters:
        n1 - The first number to add
        n2 - The second number to add
        Returns:
        The value of two numbers added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Strings cannot be parsed as ints or decimals. An empty String will throw an exception.

      • getAsString

        public java.lang.String getAsString()
        Gives a string representation of this number
        Returns:
        This number in a string format. For example, 3.46<45>/<56>
